title: The Dashboard: Bulldogs should be allowed to dream
text:
The Dashboard: Bulldogs should be allowed to dream
The
Georgia Bulldogs are set to participate in the NCAA Tournament as a No. 9 seed after overcoming a rough patch mid-season. Under head coach Mike White, the team showed resilience, finishing the regular season with four consecutive wins, marking only their sixth 20-win season. This marks a significant transition for a program that struggled in the prior year, emphasizing the tournament's value as a platform for underdogs to make their mark.
- Georgia won four straight games to secure their NCAA Tournament spot, achieving 20 regular-season victories for only the sixth time in school history.
Gonzagaleads the nation in average assists at 19.7 and assist-to-turnover ratio at 2.09.
- Gonzagaâ€™s Ryan Nembhard averages 9.8 assists per game, the highest in the country.
- Georgia is coming off a positive end to the season, competent against strong SEC competition.
- They face Gonzaga, a team with extensive tournament experience and a solid track record, including nine years of Sweet 16 appearances.
The Bulldogs will face Gonzaga in the opening round of the tournament. With their resilience and SEC experience, there's potential for an upset, making this matchup one to watch closely.Bottom Line
Georgia's journey reflects the unpredictability and excitement of the NCAA Tournament, showcasing how perseverance can lead to unexpected opportunities. The Bulldogs have a chance to prove themselves against a powerhouse, keeping the spirit of dreaming alive in college basketball.
